course.title: Performing in French: A Production of a Modern Tragedy
course.description: This course focuses on the preparation of a student-led production of a contemporary French play, and concludes with a performance in French at the end of the semester. To react to the challenges we will face in staging a "modern tragedy", we will examine the diversity of tragic forms and motifs since the 17th century up to our days through the close readings of a given set of plays, as well as the main trends in the contemporary staging, through the viewing and discussion of video versions of recent productions.
course.prerequisites: A 60-level course in French, French 71a, or permission of instructor. Interested students must apply in writing to Professor Guyot no later than January 28, 2014.
